subject: Generate consistent length passwords in AIO
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-16 14:23:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/8e70164fe0f99c69ce60385e7d2a2760d1d0d135', 'message': "Generate consistent length passwords in AIO

The bootstrap-aio.sh script generates a password by reading a set number
of characters from urandom then removing those that aren't alphanumeric.
The problem with this is that its possible for 0 characters to remain.

This patch changes the order so that tr (translate) reads urandom
directly and removes non alphanumeric characters then that output is
truncated to the required length. This ensures the generated password is
always the desired length.

Change-Id: I03984ab891f88fe4b064f7f7fcb71edf48096493
Closes-Bug: #1465684
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-16 22:25:41.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/b98422b9743c7536a82ad9f07f2e86ddddf831c5', 'message': "Generate consistent length passwords in AIO

Change-Id: I03984ab891f88fe4b064f7f7fcb71edf48096493
Closes-Bug: #1465684

commit_message:
Generate consistent length passwords in AIO

The bootstrap-aio.sh script generates a password by reading a set number
of characters from urandom then removing those that aren't alphanumeric.
The problem with this is that its possible for 0 characters to remain.

This patch changes the order so that tr (translate) reads urandom
directly and removes non alphanumeric characters then that output is
truncated to the required length. This ensures the generated password is
always the desired length.

Change-Id: I03984ab891f88fe4b064f7f7fcb71edf48096493
Closes-Bug: #1465684
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/20/192220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DEFAULT_PASSWORD=$(tr -dc 'a-zA-Z0-9' < /dev/urandom | head -c 32)

commit_message:
Unscoped Service Catalog

Update the api to allow an Unscoped Service Catalog

APIImpact

Change-Id: I269dd9d493e144a543946fb34ff5230cf50b1c9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/32/190732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Unscoped Service Catalog ========================================== Problem Description =================== Some OpenStack services allow you to talk to them using an Unscoped Keystone Token. There currently is no way to discover that list though. This will be important for the workflow as described in the Nova Instance User workflow: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186617 Proposed Change =============== * An optional flag to the API that creates an unscoped token will be added to return the unscoped service catalog along with the new token. * The existing api to allow you to fetch just the service catalog should be updated to return the unscoped service catalog when called with an unscoped token. * A new column is added to the db to mark a service as being unscoped token compatible. * The api for registering/modifying a service needs updating to support the flag. * The python-keystoneclient needs to be updated to support all of these things from python. Alternatives ------------ * Rather then add the service flag for unscoped token compatible, the unscoped service catalog can be built out of the service list where the url does not contain a '%'. Security Impact --------------- None known. Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- * python-keystoneclient will need to be updated to support these new flags Performance Impact ------------------ Minimal impact. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- Same as broken down in the Proposed Change section. Dependencies ============ None Documentation Impact ==================== The documentation related to the new flags would need to be added. References ========== Nova Instance User workflow: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186617

commit_message:
Fix function name reference in cinder.service.spec.js

This patch fixes a typo when referencing tested function names
in the it block that iterates over the tests array, so the
correct names are displayed in Jasmine spec runner.

Change-Id: I2685272063b1a599d0c4356e234a779c63d099e1
Closes-Bug: #1466543

commit_message:
Added introduction to give context to this chapter

As suggested in Bug 1443500, this patch adds a couple of paragraphs
to give some context to the section that follows on Authentication.

Closes-Bug: #1443500

Change-Id: I0189171ab9aeb3c940e302ab020ef8a7331125bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/27/192927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>Authentication is an integral part of any real world OpenStack deployment and so careful thought should be given to this aspect of system design. A complete treatment of this topic is beyond the scope of this Guide however some key topics are presented in the following sections.</para> <para>At its most basic, Authentication is the process of confirming identity - that a user is actually who they claim to be. An example of this familiar to most is providing a username and password when logging in to a system.</para>

commit_message:
Ensure /etc/nova exists before creating secret.xml

Without declaring a dependency, secret.xml can be
created before the folder is created through
the installation of the nova packages.

Closes-bug: #1458628
Change-Id: I0b9aec13866e4e334bcaf967192b2bc310ae20fb

commit_message:
NexentaStor SA: get the right LUN from mapping

In case there are several mappings for a ZVol hardcoded '0'
will result in failure of volume attachement by Nova.

Change-Id: I3f0e1ce86864eb3c496da02e4c4bdb635bbeb799
Closes-Bug: 1430961

commit_message:
Add designate-sink service

Container for Designate Sink, automatic domain creation for
enabled notification handlers (nova and/or neutron).

Change-Id: I41118cb149e7f39a17bff49123d82905b51b7939
Blueprint: designate-container
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/93/189393/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -e . /opt/kolla/kolla-common.sh . /opt/kolla/config-designate.sh CONF=/etc/designate/designate.conf get_or_create_domain() { DOMAIN_ID=$(designate domain-list | awk '/$1/ { print $2; }') if [ $DOMAIN_ID == "" ]; then DOMAIN_ID=$(designate domain-create --name $1 | \ awk '/id/ { print $4; }') fi echo DOMAIN_ID } configure_nova_handler() { crudini --set $CONF handler:nova_fixed domain_id $1 crudini --set $CONF handler:nova_fixed notification_topics "notifications" crudini --set $CONF handler:nova_fixed control_exchange "'nova'" crudini --set $CONF handler:nova_fixed format \ "'%(octet0)s-%(octet1)s-%(octet2)s-%(octet3)s.%(domain)s'" crudini --set $CONF handler:nova_fixed format \ "'%(hostname)s.%(domain)s'" } configure_neutron_handler() { crudini --set $CONF handler:neutron_floatingip domain_id $1 crudini --set $CONF handler:neutron_floatingip notification_topics \ "notifications" crudini --set $CONF handler:neutron_floatingip control_exchange \ "'neutron'" crudini --set $CONF handler:neutron_floatingip format \ "'%(octet0)s-%(octet1)s-%(octet2)s-%(octet3)s.%(domain)s'" crudini --set $CONF handler:neutron_floatingip format \ "'%(hostname)s.%(domain)s'" } check_required_vars DESIGNATE_API_SERVICE_HOST DESIGNATE_API_SERVICE_PORT \ DESIGNATE_SINK_NOVA_ENABLED \ DESIGNATE_SINK_NEUTRON_ENABLED check_for_os_service_endpoint designate DESIGNATE_API_SERVICE_HOST \ DESIGNATE_API_SERVICE_PORT || exit $? designate server-create --name ${DESIGNATE_SINK_SERVER_NAME} if [ "$DESIGNATE_SINK_NOVA_ENABLED" == true && \ "$DESIGNATE_SINK_NEUTRON_ENABLED" == true ]; then NOVA_DOMAIN_ID=$(get_or_create_domain $DESIGNATE_SINK_NOVA_DOMAIN_NAME) NEUTRON_DOMAIN_ID=$(get_or_create_domain \ $DESIGNATE_SINK_NEUTRON_DOMAIN_NAME) crudini --set $CONF service:sink enabled_notification_handlers \ "nova_fixed, neutron_floatingip" configure_nova_handler $NOVA_DOMAIN_ID configure_neutron_handler $NEUTRON_DOMAIN_ID elif [ "$DESIGNATE_SINK_NOVA_ENABLED" == true ]; then NOVA_DOMAIN_ID=$(get_or_create_domain $DESIGNATE_SINK_NOVA_DOMAIN_NAME) crudini --set $CONF service:sink enabled_notification_handlers \ "nova_fixed" configure_nova_handler $NOVA_DOMAIN_ID elif [ "$DESIGNATE_SINK_NEUTRON_ENABLED" == true ]; then NEUTRON_DOMAIN_ID=$(get_or_create_domain \ $DESIGNATE_SINK_NEUTRON_DOMAIN_NAME) crudini --set $CONF service:sink enabled_notification_handlers \ "neutron_floatingip" configure_neutron_handler $NEUTRON_DOMAIN_ID fi exec /usr/bin/designate-sink

commit_message:
Cleanup session creation

When using the session object we want to pass through unknown kwargs to
the adapter so that keystoneclient can add new parameters as required.

This requires fixing the old options so that we can restrict what is
passed and showing a warning when there are values that are being
ignored.

Change-Id: Ia795dfc8e16c60a08df1636816daefe2ebbd0b03

commit_message:
Introduce Guru Meditation Reports into Cinder

This commit integrates functionality from the
`openstack.common.report` module into Cinder.
This enables Cinder services to receive SIGUSR1
and print a Guru Meditation Report to stderr.
The required modules were added to
'openstack-common.conf' as well.

It is essentially a copy from implementation of
nova side.

Change-Id: I5bbdc0f97db9b0ebd7b48e50ab7869e2ca33aead
Implements: blueprint guru-meditation-report

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Provides a way to generate serializable reports This package/module provides mechanisms for defining reports which may then be serialized into various data types. Each report ( :class:`openstack.common.report.report.BasicReport` ) is composed of one or more report sections ( :class:`openstack.common.report.report.BasicSection` ), which contain generators which generate data models ( :class:`openstack.common.report.models.base.ReportModels` ), which are then serialized by views. """

commit_message:
Add initial "Open Source" chapter

First verison of the "Open Source" chapter covering:
- Open Source At The Core
- Acceptable Licensing
- Dependencies and Optional Modules

Change-Id: Id451266041fef8a8a56c4c4050e921fb0b81c11d
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/63/193163/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: One of the "Four Opens" which frame the basis for an OpenStack project is Open Source. OpenStack projects do not produce "open core" software, they instead produce open source software. There is a subtle but important difference between the two, but the difference is part of the foundation of OpenStack. In addition, the software is produced with a community and contributor accepted license. Open Source At The Core ======================= When we say "Open Source At the Core", what we mean is OpenStack projects should not be producing something which requires an enterprise version or some additional proprietary software. OpenStack is producing pure open source projects through it's software. Functionality should not be limited in any way. We strive to make things scalable and efficient in an open source manner. In a similar manner, projects may choose to enable pluggable functionality which allows third party projects and vendors to integrate. This type of architecture is a workable solution. An open source option, whether that is a built in solution or a third party pluggable component, is required to ensure the "open core" principle is satisfied. Acceptable Licensing ==================== OpenStack projects must utilize the Apache License, 2.0_ for the source code they produce. This is the license used by all existing OpenStack software. New projects are required to utilize this license as well. The Apache License, 2.0, provides the following benefits: * OSI approved * GPLv3 compatible * DFSG compatible Dependencies and Optional Modules ================================= When utilizing third party modules or libraries which are not Apache 2.0 licensed, contributors need to understand how the interaction between the modules will work. If there are doubts or concerns, it is recommended to put an item on the TC Meeting agenda to discuss with the TC how to proceed. In general, error on the side of caution here. With regards to dependencies, any third party libraries or modules need to be vetted through the requirements team. This ensures the added requirement of including the third party module goes through review and will not conflict with broad cross-project efforts, such as the Python 3 porting effort. .. _2.0: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

commit_message:
Add initial "Release management" chapter

First bits of the new "Release management" chapter, covering:
- Common time-based release model
- Independent release model

TODO: Library release model, Feature branches...

Change-Id: I20e0633aaa985f3db7371c01408cebdbdf768b72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/05/193505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack project teams produce a large variety of code repositories. Some are services providing infrastructure APIs. Some are libraries being consumed by those services. Some are supporting cast and tools. Most of those are formally "released" at given points. We call those "deliverables", and use git tags to define the release points. OpenStack deliverables can be released under various models. They all follow the common 6-month development cycle, but may release more than once during those cycles. The release management team manages the release process for a selection of project teams repositories (indicated by the release:managed tag) and provide tools for other teams and repositories to do self-service releases. Common time-based release model =============================== By default, most OpenStack services opt to follow the common, time-based release model. It is recommended at the earlier stages of development, when it is difficult to commit to multiple upgrade paths and large features or architectural refactors are still common. Projects following that model use a pre-version numbering scheme. If the final release will be called 5.0.0, intermediary milestones will be called 5.0.0b1, 5.0.0rc2 etc. The common 6-month time-based release cycle includes 3 development milestones, called $series-1, $series-2 and $series-3. Those make useful reference points in time to organize the development cycle. Project teams may, for example, set specific deadlines that match those dates. b1, b2 and b3 tags are pushed to the repositories to clearly mark those reference points in the git history. The dates for the milestones and final release in a given development cycle are defined by the Release Management team, and communicated before the new development cycle starts. The $series-3 milestone coincides with Feature Freeze ("FF"). Managed projects are requested to stop merging code adding new features, new dependencies, new configuration options, database schema changes, changes in strings... all things that make the work of packagers, documenters or testers more difficult. Feature Freeze Exceptions ("FFE") may be requested by PTLs to the Release managers. As we get closer to the release date, those are less likely to get accepted. After the $series-3 milestone, a list of release-critical bugs is built, and when all those are fixed (or considered not-release-critical after all), a first release candidate is tagged (rc1). This RC1 will be used as-is as the final release, unless new release-critical issues are found that warrant a RC respin. After RC1 is tagged, a stable/$series branch is cut from that same commit. That is where further release candidates (and the final release) will be tagged. The master branch starts on the new development cycle and is no longer feature-frozen. Potential new release critical issues have first to get fixed on the master branch. Once merged in master, based on their severity and the risk of regression in the patch, they may or may not trigger the opening of a new release candidate window. Once a new RC window is opened, a number of bugs are marked for backport to the stable branch, and the new RC tag is pushed when all the backports are completed. Until the final release is produced, the stable/$series branch is under the control of the release management team, to make sure that merges happen only when a release candidate window is open. On final release day, each project's last release candidate is tagged with the final release version. There is no difference between the last release candidate and the final version, apart from the version number. The stable branch passes under stable maintenance team management, and is open for backports following the stable branch rules. Independent release model ========================= Projects which want to do a formal release more often may opt for an independent model. This is especially suitable to more stable projects which add a limited set of new features and don't plan to go through large architectural changes. Getting the latest and greatest out as often as possible, while ensuring stability and upgradeability. Projects following this model do not use intermediary development milestones. They may tag new versions at any point in time during the development cycle. They do not use Feature Freeze, they do not go through a RC cycle. Those projects must tag a final version for a development cycle (generally in the last month of the cycle). A stable branch is cut from that proposed version, and the master branch will from then on produce releases of the new development cycle. If a critical issue is found in the "final release", backports can be pushed to the stable branch and a new "final release" be tagged there. That is why it is important to switch the Y component of the X.Y.Z version when we switch to the next development cycle, so that the Z component can be used in future tags on the stable branch. While the release management team will not enforce a formal feature-frozen period for projects in an independent release model, it is recommended to focus on bugfixes and hold on major disruptive features as you get closer to the end of a development cycle, to ensure that the final release of any given development cycle is as usable and bug-free as it can be. Libraries release model ======================= ... Feature branches ================ ...

commit_message:
Update of `support-modify-volume-image-metadata.rst`

Since snapshot is immutable, we shouldn't provide the capability
to update image metadata referenced with snapshot.
And part of this Spec is not well formatted, we should update it
to make it easier to read after the rst file is coverted into html
file, overall changes is listed below.

- Remove snapshot relevant changes in the SPEC.
- Fix the incorrect format which will cause the html version
  hard to read.
- Update the work items to reflect the latest changes.

Change-Id: I935ae67bca17c2eaa673d87403c0cfa8068f0922

commit_message:
Permits created guests to reach external networks

Adds MASQUERADE target on FLAT_INTERFACE in order to permit the
created guests to reach external networks.   This patch is needed
in order to avoid manual operations when testing guests connectivity.
In your local.conf file, add ALLOW_EGRESS=True in order to enable it.

Change-Id: If60d76497b19da3d936a599e142720ddcee8284b
Closes-bug: #1461228
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/98/191098/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$ALLOW_EGRESS" == "True" ]]; then sudo iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o $FLAT_INTERFACE -j MASQUERADE fi

commit_message:
fix DHCP port changed when dhcp-agent restart

When DHCP server is started, the periodic task is running
before loading cache state.The method port_update_end
need to use the cache information, but the cache information
has not been loaded.

Change-Id: I0d1da11bb559b7f0f9d4428b82573fb26916a933
Closes-Bug: #1420042

commit_message:
Fix cisco_csr_identifier_map.ipsec_site_conn_id

Some database engines require exact match of sizes of foreign keys
and referenced fields. Foreign key ipsec_site_conn_id of table
cisco_csr_identifier_map is varchar(64) but it references field
id varchar(36) of table ipsec_site_connections. This gives error
while running migration scripts in such databases.

This fix only applies to new installations. Existing databases will
be corrected by migration scripts introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/190569 - they will take care of resizing
the field and adjusting the model.

Change-Id: I6cc9625a2d96d1330b06eb727cc7fa5363c697b8
Depends-On: I384a9bbaba05ef94174b666bdcfb276eedc74134
Closes-Bug: #1463806

Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Change-Id: I6a35fa0dda798fad93b804d00a46af80f08d475c

commit_message:
Use correct rtslib namespace for newer versions

For rtslib-fb versions 2.1.52 and newer its own namespace (rtslib_fb) is
recommended instead of the older one (rtslib).

On versions with this new namespace a deprecation warning will be
thrown: "'rtslib' package name for rtslib-fb is deprecated, please
instead import 'rtslib_fb'"

This patch uses this new namespace when possible and falls back to the
older namespace if not.

Change-Id: I984105458da4d7b8736bf7c83919cbe5feb9c85a
Closes-Bug: #1460814

commit_message:
Fix noVNC console access for an IPv6 setup

Following a recent change in websocket proxy code
(commit: fdb73a2d445971c6158a80692c6f74094fd4193a),
novnc console access is not working for IPv6 addresses.
This patch fixes the issue by taking into account the way
IPv6 urls are constructed and parsing them accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1456963
Change-Id: Ia6c50be1e3cbe8a21f0a75b6a7cebd1712d311f8

commit_message:
Add ability to abandon environments

Change-Id: Ic5ac3a1e7159621b11e77371fe862c73eafac7ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-specs refs/changes/82/190482/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== Add ability to abandon environments =================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/environment-abandon The purpose is to add an ability to abandon the environment, which hangs during deployment or deleting in order to hide it from the list of other environments. Problem description =================== There are cases when the process of deleting or deploying environment may hang. Then the user has to release all used resources and manually clean the database in order to get rid of the list of failed environments. Manual cleaning of the database is unsafe and inconvenient operation. That's why `abandon` feature has to be provided. It should improve usability and allows to user to avoid direct database editing. But it is necessary to notify the user that all resources used by abandoned environment must be also released manually as previously. Proposee change =============== The implementation of this feature consists of three stages: 1) Add REST endpoint for environment-abandon New method *abandon* should be added to murano-api. It will work similar to method *delete* but without object model cleanup before direct removing environment from the database. For this action the new policy rule should be added. Any user will be able to abandon environment created by him. 2) Provide corresponding method in the python-muranoclient Method *abandon* should be added to environment manager. CLI command must also be provided. 3) Add new button *Abandon* to murano-dashboard This button should be available with any environment state Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- **DELETE /environments/<environment_id>/abandon** *Request* +----------+----------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+ | Method | URI | Description | +==========+========================================+=======================================+ | DELETE | /environments/<environment_id>/abandon | Abandon environment with specified id | +----------+----------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+ *Parameters:* * `environment_id` - environmet ID, required *Response* +----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------+ | Code | Description | +================+===========================================================+ | 200 | OK. Environment abandoned successfully | +----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------+ | 404 | Not found. Specified environment doesn`t exist | +----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------+ Versioning impact ------------------------- Murano dashboard will support only the version of the client, that includes corresponding changes. Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Murano-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- New action `Abandon` will be added to murano-dashboard. It will be always available in the row of other action. Dialog with warning should appear when user executes action Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Dmytro Dovbii Primary assignee: <ddovbii@mirantis.com> Work Items ---------- The change can be done in three Gerrit patches. Implementation is acutally completed. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit and integration tests must be done. Documentation Impact ==================== API specification should be updated References ========== None

commit_message:
Catch all exceptions around port for ip finding

If neutron does not work, then it's going to throw inside of list_ports,
which is going to send an OpenStackCloudException through search_ports,
which is then not going to be caught by the NeutronClientException trap
here.

Change-Id: Id25ff2688de55f4b39a145185269bc7b7ccb89eb

commit_message:
Refactor node's and driver's vendor passthru to a common place

This patch is refactoring the node's and driver's vendor passthru in the
API to a common place (utils.py). Historically this code was duplicated
because each endpoint supported different things (driver's vendor
passhtru endpoing being always synchrounous and node's being always
asyncronous), since now both endpoints supports the same features and
the code is almost the same it makes sense to have it in a common place,
so changing once will affect both.

Related-Blueprint: ipxe-dynamic-config
Change-Id: I16be0c787993240e55ceb13b29bcb18c21151722

commit_message:
Change return value of [driver_]vendor_passthru to dict

This is a refactor patch that changes the return value of the
vendor_passthru() and driver_vendor_passthru() RPC methods to a dictionary
instead of a tuple. By doing that we make it easy to extend for future
improvements.

The RPC version was bumped to 1.29 by this change.

Change-Id: I8729bb85d97a563d4ec8409ecd0eba15dc0c51bc
Related-Blueprint: ipxe-dynamic-config

commit_message:
Adding unit test coverage for the validate method

Adding a case in the existing unit tests to cover the ValueError
exception in the validate method of the GetInput classs. Also adding
a new yaml.

Change-Id: Ib5436d2e54cf03ea1abd03e4da3bfc7c6cc12959
Closes-Bug: #1466657

commit_message:
JSCS cleanup - horizon/static/framework conf and util

We need to do cleanup before we can enable JSCS globally
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/185725/).

This patch excludes the 'util/tech-debt' folder which is
covered in patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188316/.

Change-Id: I0b3e6435d48a24c0b24e38c96b1ce679c3268300
Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup

commit_message:
Cinder container

Cinder is going to be split up into four containers.
- cinder-api
- cinder-scheduler
- cinder-volume
- cinder-backup

Co-Authored-By: Daneyon Hansen <danehans@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

Implements: blueprint cinder-container
Closes-bug: #1460136

Change-Id: I688471151ffa54d547b9aa0f2f2e2ea7f68f288d

commit_message:
Galera container

This changes are providing support for galera cluster. It's important for
project to has got support for database cluster as a one of the steps to
providing High Avability(HA) in Kolla project

Change-Id: If51bb88ab05972d3b8aa8abbbbd2a5480213a10e
Implemented: blueprint galera-container
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/25/187225/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash echo "Running the kolla-common script" . /opt/kolla/kolla-common.sh . /opt/kolla/config-galera.sh configure_db if [[ "${CLUSTER_MASTER}" == "`hostname`" ]]; then echo "STARTING NEW CLUSTER..." mysqld_safe --init-file="$TEMP_FILE" --wsrep-new-cluster else echo "JOINING CLUSTER..." mysqld_safe --init-file="$TEMP_FILE" fi

commit_message:
Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Change-Id: Ida50fc2a187f08e0da53f27ae88e9ccce4f6b862

commit_message:
Added keystone auth configuration to the tuskar element

Change-Id: Icf8ccc2b802315cb77898f363bcf9cf89cb46e8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/17/185117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [DEFAULT] auth_strategy=keystone [keystone_authtoken] admin_password={{tuskar.service-password}} admin_tenant_name=service admin_user=tuskar auth_uri = http://{{keystone.host}}:5000/v2.0 identity_uri=http://{{keystone.host}}:35357

commit_message:
zuul: actually enable puppet4 voting

In a previous patch, I attempted to make puppet4 jobs voting for Puppet
OpenStack modules, after Juno release.
This patch aims to actually enable the voting.

Change-Id: I77cc8b6f3c0cd3ace7485ce67c81b3a7476427fe

commit_message:
Fix beaker on Trusty and  update .gitreview file

* Update .gitreview file because of Puppet OpenStack modules project
  renaming.
* Fix Beaker tests on Ubuntu Trusty (newline added if secret)

We have to do that in a single patch because:
* project has been renamed so gitreview needs to be updated
* beaker jobs are voting

Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sebastien Badia <sbadia@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1465780
Change-Id: If562aa5bc969c316fd8fd0cb06ed7115c465a57d

commit_message:
Add lbaas configuration opt in config-reference

neutron-lbaas has now its own repository and the configuration options have
moved in different files. This should be reflected in the admin-cloud-guide
and the configuration reference.

Change-Id: Id3c3e0c85b214114d5c98000bc5d7916c5d65b49
Closes-Bug: #1449847
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/01/192601/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
Description of Load-Balancer-as-a-Service agent configuration options
Configuration option = Default value Description
[DEFAULT]
= 10 (IntOpt) Seconds between periodic task runs.
= neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.drivers.haproxy.namespace_driver.HaproxyNSDriver (MultiStrOpt) Drivers used to manage loadbalancing devices.
[haproxy]
= $state_path/lbaas (StrOpt) Location to store config and state files.
= nogroup (StrOpt) The user group.
= 3 (IntOpt) When delete and re-add the same vip, send this many gratuitous ARPs to flush the ARP cache in the Router. Set it below or equal to 0 to disable this feature.

commit_message:
ZeroMQ driver Req/Rep implementation

Address spec https://review.openstack.org/#/c/171131/
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/zmq-req-rep

Change-Id: Iad0b3bb8721253163571db335942d34d8e362e90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/01/182201/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging import zmq from oslo_messaging._drivers import base from oslo_messaging._drivers.zmq_driver import zmq_serializer from oslo_messaging._drivers.zmq_driver import zmq_topic as topic_utils from oslo_messaging._drivers.zmq_driver.rpc.server.zmq_base_consumer import ConsumerBase LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class ZmqIncomingCastMessage(base.IncomingMessage): def __init__(self, listener, context, message): super(ZmqIncomingCastMessage, self).__init__(listener, context, message) def reply(self, reply=None, failure=None, log_failure=True): ''' No reply for cast/fanout message ''' pass def acknowledge(self): pass def requeue(self): pass class CastConsumer(ConsumerBase): def __init__(self, listener, conf): super(CastConsumer, self).__init__(listener, conf, zmq.Poller()) def poll(self, timeout=None): socks = dict(self.poller.poll(timeout)) if socks: for socket in socks: try: message = socket.recv_multipart() context, message = zmq_serializer.deserialize_cast_message(message) return ZmqIncomingCastMessage(self.listener, context, message) except zmq.ZMQError as e: LOG.error(_("Receiving message failed ... {}", e)) return None def stop(self): pass def cleanup(self): pass def listen(self, target): topic = topic_utils.Topic.from_target(target) connect_address = topic_utils.get_ipc_address_cast(self.conf, topic) sub_socket = self.context.socket(zmq.SUB) sub_socket.bind(connect_address) sub_socket.setsockopt(zmq.SUBSCRIBE, topic.topic) self.sockets_per_topic[str(topic)] = sub_socket self.poller.register(sub_socket, zmq.POLLIN)

commit_message:
Add client_socket_timeout option

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour.  Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 9292
real    1m0.063s

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1371022
Change-Id: I9e7edcbf25ece61dc16b8cd5a8bef5ed9a14e3d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/32/119132/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Timeout (in seconds) for client connections' socket operations. If an incoming # connection is idle for this period it will be closed. A value of "0" # means wait forever. #eventlet_socket_timeout = 900

commit_message:
Change set_override() calls to use flags() instead

A few test cases used the set_override() method to change
the CONF variables instead of self.flags().  This goes against
the nova hacking rules since it can affect down stream test
cases.

Change-Id: Iff2b38cda5cd773887f36f765013fe4adfada35b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/24/193324/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import logging self.flags(disk_driver='localdisk')

commit_message:
Add Link to governance.openstack.org to docs.o.o pages

Break out the common content with "Contributor Guides" to its own
template for sharing between the various files.

Add a link to the TC documents to the Contributor Guides section.

commit_message:
Add glance_store to projects.txt

glance requires glance_store but the requirements in glance_store on
master and stable/kilo don't line up with what's in
global-requirements.txt so add glance_store to projects.txt to sync
those up.

Conflicts:
        projects.txt

Closes-Bug: #1454695
Related-Bug: #1454467

Change-Id: Ib41b0c482edf39017f26e483cd3661ca5b540133
(cherry picked from commit 64091866112ac6b3590de8b6d3c036cc03dcd6e0)

commit_message:
Fixed issue with rabbitmq_ha_queues for Heat

We can see on HA deployments 'rabbitmq_ha_queues=False' in Heat
configuration file. In the result Heat doesn't work after the
destructive scenarios.

Change-Id: Iaa77b875928b94b79ab8a5e039cbbfe0d1908b35
Closes-Bug: #1465840

commit_message:
Fixed issue with rabbitmq_ha_queues for Heat

We can see on HA deployments 'rabbitmq_ha_queues=False' in Heat
configuration file. In the result Heat doesn't work after the
destructive scenarios.

Change-Id: I7b800e7414fa40f1b23690de6e03d36bd62fe161
Closes-Bug: #1466810

commit_message:
Clean bdms and networks after deleting shelved VM

After deleting the shelved offloaded instance with user volumes,
the bdms and networks info should be cleanup. This patch use local
deleting to cleanup the instance info.

(cherry picked from commit 54f4600c82241ad6ae6768d3dcd1e1755dac4ddc)
Conflicts:
	nova/compute/api.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

Closes-bug: #1307791
change-Id: Id32385df5b20903d7a019c3590432f3fb1133f90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/142033/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if instance.vm_state in (vm_states.SHELVED, vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED): shelved_offloaded = (instance.vm_state == vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED) if not instance.host and not shelved_offloaded: is_local_delete = True try: if not shelved_offloaded: service = objects.Service.get_by_compute_host( context.elevated(), instance.host) is_local_delete = not self.servicegroup_api.service_is_up( service) if not is_local_delete: task_states.SOFT_DELETING): if is_local_delete: # If instance is in shelved_offloaded state or compute node # isn't up, delete instance from db and clean bdms info and # network info if instance.vm_state == vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED: LOG.info(_("instance is in SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, cleanup" " the instance's info from database."), instance=instance) else: LOG.warning(_("instance's host %s is down, deleting from " "database"), instance.host, instance=instance) # NOTE(liusheng): In nova-network multi_host scenario,deleting # network info of the instance may need instance['host'] as # destination host of RPC call. If instance in SHELVED_OFFLOADED # state, instance['host'] is None, here, use shelved_host as host # to deallocate network info and reset instance['host'] after that. # Here we shouldn't use instance.save(), because this will mislead # user who may think the instance's host has been changed, and # actually, the instance.host is always None. orig_host = instance.host try: if instance.vm_state == vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED: instance['host'] = instance._system_metadata.get( 'shelved_host') self.network_api.deallocate_for_instance(elevated, instance) finally: instance['host'] = orig_host
deleted_lines: host = instance['host'] if instance['vm_state'] in (vm_states.SHELVED, vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED): if not host: is_up = False try: service = objects.Service.get_by_compute_host( context.elevated(), instance.host) if self.servicegroup_api.service_is_up(service): is_up = True task_states.SOFT_DELETING): if not is_up: # If compute node isn't up, just delete from DB LOG.warning(_("instance's host %s is down, deleting from " "database") % instance['host'], instance=instance) self.network_api.deallocate_for_instance(elevated, instance)

commit_message:
Statistics for events

Change-Id: Ibad40e2bbb1db77a8c6df1fd8dc34f08124b024f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/10/155310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================= Event statistics ======================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/event-statistics Problem description =================== Not so far along some customers asked a questions about redundant samples and how collect usage time statistics for any resource for period. For example count and active time for instances. We recommended using events for this. At the same time events storages implement only simple request as adding or getting events and traits. If we want to get some analyzed data we should write custom tool script for reading data via api and analyzing it. It's better if ceilometer have native statitics for events. Proposed change =============== Like as meter statistics this feature will be implemented at storage layer. It'll include a standart set of methods and realized in ceilometer aggregation functions stddev and cardinality. Statistics will be queryiable by event_type, timestamp and trait fields. Also they'll have groupby function by trait. For mongodb backend statistics will be implemented via native map-reduce tools. For sqalchemy we'll use method that relative to _make_stats_query. HBase meter statistics implemented as naive reading and calculating data currently. So event statisitics will be same. Elastic search statitics will be implemented via native tools. Api will be relative to meter statistics api. Alternatives ------------ Make a tools for collecting event data via api and analyze their outside ceilometer Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- Add a new api method "event_statistics" Security impact --------------- None. Pipeline impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- You may make request for collecting events statistics. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ityaptin Work Items ---------- - implement statitics on different backends - improve rest api Future lifecycle ================ None Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= - extend api and storage scenarios testing to include new feature Documentation Impact ==================== - update api notes References ========== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/event-statistics

subject: VMware: better exception handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-14 12:28:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8b782d3b7b60d91916710b458575b2512e29199e', 'message': 'VMware: better exception handling

Commit 1668fef9cabea6a23023aab6b97617b4368b14d6 corrected many
wrongs that we have with the oslo.vmware exceptions. The problem
is that that patch broke nova. This patch addresses the code in
Nova to enable it to upgrade to a oslo.vmware package that has
better exception handling.

The patch does the following:
1. Ensures that place that treated VMwareDriverException will also
   treat VimFaultException. This will ensure that the code is backward
   and forward compatible
2. Fixes unit tests to ensure the above

Note: I have tested the code with oslo.vmware 0.13.0

Closes-Bug: #1459021

Change-Id: I8da60c8e31aad83f75218a3c9d49a7cd515f47f2

commit_message:
VMware: better exception handling

Commit 1668fef9cabea6a23023aab6b97617b4368b14d6 corrected many
wrongs that we have with the oslo.vmware exceptions. The problem
is that that patch broke nova. This patch addresses the code in
Nova to enable it to upgrade to a oslo.vmware package that has
better exception handling.

The patch does the following:
1. Ensures that place that treated VMwareDriverException will also
   treat VimFaultException. This will ensure that the code is backward
   and forward compatible
2. Fixes unit tests to ensure the above

Note: I have tested the code with oslo.vmware 0.13.0

Closes-Bug: #1459021

Change-Id: I8da60c8e31aad83f75218a3c9d49a7cd515f47f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/191569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(garyk): The olso.vmware library currently raises the exception # vexc.VMwareDriverException. This is incorrect and it should raise # the vexc.VimFaultException. That is the actual exception that is raised # from the VC. Both exceptions are handled here to ensure that Nova will # be backward compatible with oslo.vmware. This will enable the library to # raise the correct exceptions moving forwards. except (vexc.VMwareDriverException, vexc.VimFaultException):

commit_message:
Revert "Make kolla functional job voting"

Apparently the gate needs more work in Kolla to be stable.  I
have filed a Critial bug here after which we should be able to
revert this revert ;)

https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1466677

This reverts commit 6d3e0cac215f007ea2419de517a6db7ce64820d4.

Change-Id: Ie7f7b4b5db019ea6298fe103aff8c26eedcfa214

commit_message:
Adding paramiko injections check to blacklist functions

This commit adds a check for paramiko.exec_command, as it sends
the command directly to shell, and may be vulnerable to a command
injection vulnerability if called with untrusted input.  This
commit also checks paramiko.invoke_shell, which may be similarly
vulnerable.

Change-Id: I51ce997073eae94c910483790f172afdbf407e7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/20/192920/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - paramiko_exec_command: qualnames: [paramiko.exec_command] message: "Paramiko command execution uses shell. Check for command injection vulnerabilities."

commit_message:
Fixes nova rescue / unrescue

Removes extra argument passed to _create_root_vhd by the rescue_instance
method.
Fixes the arguments passed from driver to vmops for unrescue.
Avoids deletion of 'None' file during unrescue.

Change-Id: I1636783c2681392654c6a3fcf7dd0997d6b46e1b
(cherry picked from commit f106b6ed78a7aca688e72ca1ec094867dee1a547)

commit_message:
The devref for Nova stable API

This document describes the expect of Nova REST API from Nova team. Also can
resolve some confuse what you see in the current Nova code. The Nova team will
try to reach the final goal of this document described.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia837bca561fa8a7c48eadfcd9bd791dc8c8d29ac

commit_message:
Removing unnecessary test setting of dashboards

HORIZON_CONFIG is still being used to set default values for
dashboards and default_dashboard. This method of specifying these
is deprecated. All of these default behaviors are now covered in
the enabled directory. Removing them to remove seeing the
deprecation warning every time tests run.

Closes-Bug: #1466671
Change-Id: Ifd833288f0bf2992bd810a93a74a799232f119ab

commit_message:
Pass proxy environment variables to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox fails even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem by passing (upper case and lower case)
http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy from environment to tox.

See: commit 2d02ebb775ec44a14e325c56d4a901c5705fbb94

Change-Id: Ib7964fd5ea4fb8398cdb4cd94a70fe7fae49f973
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/03/191603/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: passenv = http_proxy HTTP_PROXY https_proxy HTTPS_PROXY no_proxy NO_PROXY

commit_message:
[Manila] Add scenario for creation/deletion of Manila share networks

List of changes:
- Added support of 'create' and 'delete' operations for share networks.
- Added benchmark for creating and deleting share networks.

Change-Id: I25ffb2d8d769f6d81972f8773951246f11abb2a0

subject: Fix unicode/bytes issues in API v2 tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-15 16:43:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/1c87bb601645c0fd67c8fa936fa9d5b4a3f87712', 'message': "Fix Python 3 issues in tests.api.v2

* CombinationEvaluator: on Python 3, convert states (built using zip) to
  a list because states is consumed more than once. On Python 3, zip()
  returns an iterator which can only be consumed once.
* HTTP body is a bytes string: fix unit tests to use bytes instead of
  native string (Unicode on Python 3).
* test_alarm_scenarios: format key and value representation at runtime
  instead of using hardcoded value because repr(u'abc) doesn't start
  with u'...' prefix anymore on Python 3.
* Replace dict.keys()[0] with list(dict.keys())[0]. On Python 3, keys()
  returns an iterator which is not indexable.
* test_list_meters_scenarios: base64.encodestring() returns a byte
  string whereas the test expects a native string (so Unicode on
  Python 3). On Python 3, decode the string from ASCII to get Unicode.
* AggregatorTransformer: replace dict.values() with list(dict.values())
  to get a copy of the list of values on Python 3, instead of a view
  (still connected to the dictionary).
* Add the following tests of ceilometer.tests.api.v2 to tox -e py34:

  - test_alarm_scenarios.TestAlarms.test_alarms_query_with_timestamp
  - test_complex_query
  - test_complex_query_scenarios.TestQueryMetersController.test_query_with_isotime

commit_message:
Fix unicode/bytes issues in API v2 tests

* HTTP body type is bytes: fix tests to use bytes strings.
* test_list_resources_scenarios: on Python 3, base64.encodestring() returns
  bytes whereas the test expects bytes; decode the result from ASCII.
* tox.ini: add the following API v2 tests to Python 3.4:

  - test_alarm_scenarios.TestAlarms.test_alarms_query_with_timestamp
  - test_complex_query_scenarios.TestQueryMetersController.test_query_with_isotime
  - test_list_resources_scenarios.TestListResources.test_with_invalid_resource_id

Change-Id: I8258c2d17fbc1236f4bcda40bff93a93bddf13e2

commit_message:
Fix up README to work with the release tools

Add links to the bug tracker and source in a way the release script can
find them.

Move the contributing instructions to a separate file, where github will
pick them up and the release tools won't be confused by the urls.

Change-Id: Icbc1fdde3245ef6aa750bd44601adb1514763034
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/39/193539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * License: Apache License, Version 2.0 * Source: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-doc-tools * Bugs: http://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals
deleted_lines: Contributing ============ Our community welcomes all people interested in open source cloud computing, and encourages you to join the `OpenStack Foundation <http://www.openstack.org/join>`_. The best way to get involved with the community is to talk with others online or at a meetup and offer contributions through our processes, the `OpenStack wiki <http://wiki.openstack.org>`_, blogs, or on IRC at ``#openstack`` on ``irc.freenode.net``. We welcome all types of contributions, from blueprint designs to documentation to testing to deployment scripts. If you would like to contribute to the development, you must follow the steps in this page: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html Once those steps have been completed, changes to OpenStack should be submitted for review via the Gerrit tool, following the workflow documented at: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#development-workflow Pull requests submitted through GitHub will be ignored. Bugs should be filed on Launchpad, not GitHub: https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals

commit_message:
Add 'docker' to the list of known hypervisor types

nova-docker is out of tree, but it's starting to be used by people, and
being able to use a docker-specific hypervisor type can be quite useful
(in mixed-hypervisor environments, for instance).

Change-Id: I5a50de6bf73372f1ab999fd977aa58b33ffacfb9
(cherry picked from commit 2a21fcd073b44eb32f821fe3eb938dba7c34f6bc)

commit_message:
Add a scenario test for default route behavior

This test ensures that internet is available for an instance only if an
internet gateway is set as the default router.

Change-Id: Iadcf23c89e01bdf63002033c95615ee1e3f9f31d

subject: Running with 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=pbr' causes failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-18 16:30:44.000000000', 'files': ['lib/infra'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/fe67976512075b6f0eacf48c280cc9ab9adbef64', 'message': 'Running with 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=pbr' causes failure

If you have 'pbr' in your LIBS_FROM_GIT list, then the following error
occurs:

+ cd /opt/stack/requirements
/home/ubuntu/devstack/inc/python: line 229: cd: /opt/stack/requirements:
No such file or directory

This is due to commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192494 moving
the clone of 'requirements' after 'setup_lib "pbr"' - which depends
on the directory existing.

The fix is to move the clone back before the pbr section,
leaving the pip_install for afterwards.

Change-Id: I04bd887d3c8157533f79cb737d040a5803c7a9dd
Closes-Bug: #1466577
'}]
commit_message:
Running with 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=pbr' causes failure

If you have 'pbr' in your LIBS_FROM_GIT list, then the following error
occurs:

+ cd /opt/stack/requirements
/home/ubuntu/devstack/inc/python: line 229: cd: /opt/stack/requirements:
No such file or directory

This is due to commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192494 moving
the clone of 'requirements' after 'setup_lib "pbr"' - which depends
on the directory existing.

The fix is to move the clone back before the pbr section,
leaving the pip_install for afterwards.

Change-Id: I04bd887d3c8157533f79cb737d040a5803c7a9dd
Closes-Bug: #1466577

subject: Strip markers from test requirements.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 00:19:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/commit/72d33ae2d4a5928085e67f5f0f4fdd7a2c8c56a0', 'message': "Strip markers from test requirements.

Setuptools doesn't [yet] support markeres in tests_require parameters
to setup(). While we need to get that fixed, we also need to support
syncing marker constrained requirements from global-requirements.

Since version constraints are needed to successfully port to Python3
this won't be a long term viable solution: but few (none today) of our
test-only dependencies require version constraints, so we can do this
in the interim.

Change-Id: I31adaf35c8d7b72fe3f8c9242cc356fe34d537e8

Change-Id: I31adaf35c8d7b72fe3f8c9242cc356fe34d537e8

commit_message:
Strip markers from test requirements.

Setuptools doesn't [yet] support markeres in tests_require parameters
to setup(). While we need to get that fixed, we also need to support
syncing marker constrained requirements from global-requirements.

Since version constraints are needed to successfully port to Python3
this won't be a long term viable solution: but few of our test-only
dependencies require version constraints, so we can do this in the
interim. The ones that do - such as python-mysql - we're either
moving away from, or centralising them into optional dependencies
on other packages where the tests_require limitation shouldn't apply.

Change-Id: I31adaf35c8d7b72fe3f8c9242cc356fe34d537e8

Adding ResellerAdmin role to Ceilometer user

Swift polling requires ResellerAdmin role to be added to the
Ceilometer user. This was already added to register_endpoint.sh
so it needs to be also in os-cloud-config.

commit_message:
Test if Undercloud Ceilometer monitors Overcloud

A simple test if some hardware meter has been created inside
Ceilometer. That means Ceilometer has been able to poll the
statistics from at least one Overcloud Node.

Depends on Ceilometer patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/92370/

Change-Id: I0dcfa03b3aa69cc2a83566757ebcace6eb62dd16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/79/101479/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## #. _`Test if Undercloud Ceilometer monitors the Overcloud hardware ## :: if [ "$USE_UNDERCLOUD_UI" -ne 0 ] ; then ## switch to Undercloud source $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-incubator/undercloudrc ## check if some hardware meter has been created, that means Ceilometer got at least one hardware sample wait_for 5 10 ceilometer meter-list \| grep 'hardware.disk.size.total' ## switch back to Overcloud source $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-incubator/overcloudrc fi ### --end

commit_message:
Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect

Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect feature in lm-sensors.
If passing run_sensors_detect parameter through heat, sensors-detect
will be invoked with default input.
According to documentation this step is mandatory, though sensors
might be visible after installing lm-sensors without running detect.

Change-Id: I8e361b60fce8215d0e4666c8c38c86985dda8261
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/82/102182/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RUN_SENSORS_DETECT=$(os-apply-config --key snmpd.run_sensors_detect --type raw --key-default '') if [ "$RUN_SENSORS_DETECT" = "True" ];then # This is a temporary solution how to run sensors-detect with default attributes. # New version of sensors detect contains --auto parameter instead. Switch to this # when the new version is available in the package. (while :; do echo ""; done ) | sensors-detect fi

Adding script for TripleO default set of test data

-script for TripleO test data with default set of meters
-adding definition of Sensor, the representation of hardware
 sensors

Closes-Bug: #1349791
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/47/109947/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # -*- encoding: utf-8 -*- # # Copyright  2012 New Dream Network, LLC (DreamHost) # # Author: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Command line tool for creating default test data set for TripleO-UI. You need to deploy your Overcloud first. This script will obtain all running nova instances and will create statistics for them. Usage: #1. you can clear you db first, for mysql use this: db_pass=$(os-apply-config --key db-password) echo "drop database ceilometer" | mysql os-db-create ceilometer ceilometer $db_pass ceilometer-dbsync --config-file /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf #2. generate testing data for e.g. last 2 days source .tox/py27/bin/activate ./tools/tripleo_ui_ceilometer_test_data.py --time_period 2 """ from __future__ import print_function import datetime import logging import sys import argparse from oslo.config import cfg from ceilometer import nova_client from ceilometer import storage from ceilometer.hardware.pollsters import util from ceilometer.hardware.inspector import base from ceilometer.openstack.common import log from ceilometer.openstack.common import network_utils from tools.make_test_data import make_test_data LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) DEFAULT_METERS = { "hardware.cpu.load.1min": { "type": "gauge", "unit": "process", "random_min": 0, "random_max": 1.0, }, "hardware.cpu.load.5min": { "type": "gauge", "unit": "process", "random_min": 0, "random_max": 1.0, }, "hardware.cpu.load.15min": { "type": "gauge", "unit": "process", "random_min": 0, "random_max": 1.0, }, "hardware.disk.size.total": { "type": "gauge", "unit": "B", "volume": 64420000000, "devices": [ base.Disk(device='/dev/sda3', path='/'), base.Disk(device='tmpfs', path='/dev/shm'), base.Disk(device='tmpfs', path='/run'), base.Disk(device='tmpfs', path='/sys/fs/cgroup'), base.Disk(device='/dev/sda1', path='/mnt'), base.Disk(device='tmpfs', path='/run/netns'), ] }, "random_max": 1000, }, "hardware.system_stats.io.raw_received": { "type": "cumulative", "unit": "block", "random_min": 0, "random_max": 1000, }, "hardware.network.ip.out_requests": { "type": "cumulative", "unit": "datagram", "random_min": 0, "random_max": 1000, }, "hardware.network.ip.in_receives": { "type": "cumulative", "unit": "datagram", "random_min": 0, "random_max": 1000, }, base.Sensor(name='Core0 Temp'), base.Sensor(name='Core1 Temp'), base.Sensor(name='temp 1'), base.Sensor(name='temp 2'), base.Sensor(name='temp 3'), ] }, "hardware.sensors.temperature": { "type": "gauge", "unit": "rpm", "random_min": 0, "random_max": 3000, "devices": [ base.Sensor(name='fan1'), base.Sensor(name='fan2'), base.Sensor(name='fan3'), ] }, "hardware.sensors.voltage": { "type": "gauge", "unit": "mV", "random_min": 1500, "random_max": 12000, "devices": [ base.Sensor(name='VCore 1'), base.Sensor(name='VCore 2'), base.Sensor(name='+3.3V'), base.Sensor(name='+5V'), base.Sensor(name='+12V'), base.Sensor(name='-12V'), base.Sensor(name='-5V'), base.Sensor(name='V5SB'), base.Sensor(name='VBat'), ] }, "hardware.sensors.misc": { "type": "gauge", "unit": "misc", "random_min": 0, "random_max": 3000, "devices": [ base.Sensor(name='vid'), base.Sensor(name='vrm'), base.Sensor(name='alarms'), ] }, } def main(): cfg.CONF([], project='ceilometer') parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description='generate metering data', ) parser.add_argument( '--time_period', help='How many days back should be the data generated.', type=int, default=2, ) parser.add_argument( '--interval', help='The period between events, in minutes.', type=int, default=10, ) args = parser.parse_args() # Set up logging to use the console console = logging.StreamHandler(sys.stderr) console.setLevel(logging.DEBUG) formatter = logging.Formatter('%(message)s') console.setFormatter(formatter) root_logger = logging.getLogger('') root_logger.addHandler(console) root_logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG) # Get nova client nova_cli = nova_client.Client() # Get all the active nova instances and their IP addresses instances = nova_cli.instance_get_all() ip_addresses = [] for instance in instances: try: ip_address = instance.addresses['ctlplane'][0]['addr'] ip_addresses.append(ip_address) except KeyError: print("Couldn't obtain IP address of" "instance %s" % instance.id) # Connect to the metering database conn = storage.get_connection_from_config(cfg.CONF) # Compute the correct time span end = datetime.datetime.utcnow() time_period = datetime.timedelta(days=args.time_period) start = end - time_period # Store default set of samples for every nova instance and default meter for ip_address in ip_addresses: for meter_name, settings in DEFAULT_METERS.items(): devices = settings.get('devices', [None]) for device in devices: resource_metadata = util.make_metadata( res_metadata=device, host_url=network_utils.urlsplit(ip_address)) make_test_data(conn = conn, name=meter_name, meter_type=settings['type'], unit=settings['unit'], volume=settings.get('volume', 0), random_min=settings.get('random_min', None), random_max=settings.get('random_max', None), user_id=None, project_id=None, resource_id=ip_address, start=start, end=end, interval=args.interval, resource_metadata=resource_metadata, source='artificial',) return 0 if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Allowing system level stats

Adding 1.3.6.1.4.1.2021 for total_swap, avail_swap, cpu_idle
io_raw_sent and io_raw_received.

Adding 1.3.6.1.2.1.4 for ip_out_requests and ip_in_requests.

commit_message:
Switch to os-cloud-config register-endpoints

Switching to os-cloud-config register-endpoints. Changing interface
to new one.

Endpoints will be created exatly the same as before, so this change
is backwards compatible.

Roles are created as part of register endpoints now.

Depends on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132983/
Without this patch there is failure while uploading image
using Overcloud Glance.

Change-Id: I90c5fd909459e2e41641fd49ce6ea00cc554de8e

deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -eu SCRIPT_NAME=$(basename $0) SCRIPT_HOME=$(dirname $0) function show_options () { echo "Usage: $SCRIPT_NAME [options] <controlplane-ip>" echo echo "Perform initial setup of a cloud running on <controlplane-ip>" echo echo "This will register ec2, image, orchestration, identity, network, " echo "volume (optional), dashboard (optional), metering (optional) and " echo "compute services as running on the default ports on controlplane-ip." echo echo "Options:" echo " -r, --region -- Override the default region 'regionOne'." echo " --ceilometer-password -- Specify a password for ceilometer" echo " --cinder-password -- Specify a password for cinder." echo " --glance-password -- Specify a password for glance." echo " --heat-password -- Specify a password for heat." echo " --ironic-password -- Specify a password for ironic." echo " --neutron-password -- Specify a password for neutron." echo " --nova-password -- Specify a password for nova." echo " --swift-password -- Specify a password for swift" echo " --tuskar-password -- Specify a password for tuskar" echo " --enable-horizon -- Enable horizon" echo " --debug -- Debug the API calls made." echo " --ssl -- Use SSL public endpoints. Takes the hostname to" echo " use for the public endpoints." echo " --public -- Use non-SSL public endpoints. Takes the ip/hostname" echo " to use for the public endpoints." echo echo "For instance: $SCRIPT_NAME 192.0.2.1" echo "For instance(ssl): $SCRIPT_NAME --ssl mysite.org 192.0.2.1" exit $1 } DEBUG="" CEILOMETER_PASSWORD="" CINDER_PASSWORD="" GLANCE_PASSWORD="" HEAT_PASSWORD="" IRONIC_PASSWORD="" NEUTRON_PASSWORD="" NOVA_PASSWORD="" SWIFT_PASSWORD="" TUSKAR_PASSWORD="" ENABLE_HORIZON="" SSL="" PUBLIC="" REGION="regionOne" #NB: This is the keystone default. TEMP=`getopt -o r: -l region:,debug,ceilometer-password:,cinder-password:,glance-password:,heat-password:,ironic-password:,public:,neutron-password:,nova-password:,swift-password:,tuskar-password:,enable-horizon,ssl: -n $SCRIPT_NAME -- "$@"` if [ $? != 0 ] ; then echo "Terminating..." >&2 ; exit 1 ; fi # Note the quotes around `$TEMP': they are essential! eval set -- "$TEMP" while true ; do case "$1" in -r|--region) export REGION=$2; shift 2 ;; --debug) export DEBUG=--debug; set -x; shift 1;; --ceilometer-password) export CEILOMETER_PASSWORD=$2; shift 2 ;; --cinder-password) export CINDER_PASSWORD=$2; shift 2 ;; --glance-password) export GLANCE_PASSWORD=$2; shift 2 ;; --heat-password) export HEAT_PASSWORD=$2; shift 2 ;; --ironic-password) export IRONIC_PASSWORD=$2; shift 2 ;; --neutron-password) export NEUTRON_PASSWORD=$2; shift 2 ;; --nova-password) export NOVA_PASSWORD=$2; shift 2 ;; --public) export PUBLIC=$2; shift 2 ;; --swift-password) export SWIFT_PASSWORD=$2; shift 2 ;; --tuskar-password) export TUSKAR_PASSWORD=$2; shift 2 ;; --enable-horizon) export ENABLE_HORIZON=--enable-horizon; shift 1;; --ssl) export SSL=$2; shift 2 ;; -h) show_options 0;; --) shift ; break ;; *) echo "Error: unsupported option $1." ; exit 1 ;; esac done HOST=${1:-""} EXTRA=${2:-""} if [ -z "$HOST" -o -n "$EXTRA" ]; then show_options 1 fi INTERNAL_HOST=http://${HOST}: if [ -n "$SSL" ]; then PUBLIC_HOST=https://${SSL}: elif [ -n "$PUBLIC" ]; then PUBLIC_HOST=http://${PUBLIC}: else PUBLIC_HOST=$INTERNAL_HOST fi # Skip Heat for now... see heat bug https://launchpad.net/bugs/1235555 NORMAL_PORT=8004 SSL_PORT=8004 PASSWORD=$HEAT_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Heat Service" heat orchestration -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}${NORMAL_PORT} ${PUBLIC_HOST}${SSL_PORT} NORMAL_PORT=9696 SSL_PORT=${SSL:+13696} SSL_PORT=${SSL_PORT:-$NORMAL_PORT} PASSWORD=$NEUTRON_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Neutron Service" neutron network -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}${NORMAL_PORT} ${PUBLIC_HOST}${SSL_PORT} NORMAL_PORT=9292 SSL_PORT=${SSL:+13292} SSL_PORT=${SSL_PORT:-$NORMAL_PORT} PASSWORD=$GLANCE_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Glance Image Service" glance image -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}${NORMAL_PORT} ${PUBLIC_HOST}${SSL_PORT} NORMAL_PORT=8773 SSL_PORT=${SSL:+13773} SSL_PORT=${SSL_PORT:-$NORMAL_PORT} register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "EC2 Compatibility Layer" ec2 ec2 -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}${NORMAL_PORT} ${PUBLIC_HOST}${SSL_PORT} NORMAL_PORT=8774 SSL_PORT=${SSL:+13774} SSL_PORT=${SSL_PORT:-$NORMAL_PORT} PASSWORD=$NOVA_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Nova Compute Service" nova compute -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}${NORMAL_PORT} ${PUBLIC_HOST}${SSL_PORT} PASSWORD=$NOVA_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Nova Compute Service v3" nova computev3 -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}${NORMAL_PORT} ${PUBLIC_HOST}${SSL_PORT} if [ -n "$CEILOMETER_PASSWORD" ]; then # Updating Ceilometer to be like other services NORMAL_PORT=8777 SSL_PORT=${SSL:+13777} SSL_PORT=${SSL_PORT:-$NORMAL_PORT} PASSWORD=$CEILOMETER_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Ceilometer Service" ceilometer metering -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}${NORMAL_PORT} ${PUBLIC_HOST}${SSL_PORT} fi if [ -n "$CINDER_PASSWORD" ]; then NORMAL_PORT=8776 SSL_PORT=${SSL:+13776} SSL_PORT=${SSL_PORT:-$NORMAL_PORT} PASSWORD=$CINDER_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Cinder Volume Service" cinder volume -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}${NORMAL_PORT} ${PUBLIC_HOST}${SSL_PORT} fi if [ -n "$SWIFT_PASSWORD" ]; then NORMAL_PORT=8080 SSL_PORT=${SSL:+13080} SSL_PORT=${SSL_PORT:-$NORMAL_PORT} PASSWORD=$SWIFT_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Swift Object Storage Service" swift object-store -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}${NORMAL_PORT} ${PUBLIC_HOST}${SSL_PORT} fi if [ -n "$ENABLE_HORIZON" ]; then # XXX: SSL not wired up yet. register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "OpenStack Dashboard" horizon dashboard -i ${INTERNAL_HOST} ${INTERNAL_HOST} fi if [ -n "$IRONIC_PASSWORD" ]; then # XXX: SSL not wired up yet. PASSWORD=$IRONIC_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Ironic Service" ironic baremetal -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}6385 ${PUBLIC_HOST}6385 fi if [ -n "$TUSKAR_PASSWORD" ]; then # XXX: SSL not wired up yet. PASSWORD=$TUSKAR_PASSWORD register-endpoint $DEBUG -r $REGION -d "Tuskar Service" tuskar management -i ${INTERNAL_HOST}8585 ${PUBLIC_HOST}8585 fi

commit_message:
RN6.1 Ceilometer new features

This patch adds a section with Ceilometer new features to the
MOS 6.1 Release Notes.

Change-Id: Ida9abf7a736b6e5d39c8f887817a7d0dd5fd4e2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/19/170919/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Ceilometer new features ======================= Mirantis OpenStack 6.1 includes a number of improvements for Telemetry module: * new method of partitioning alarm evaluation load using `tooz`_ coordination, as opposed to a hand-crafted protocol. See the `Rebase partitioned alarm evaluation on tooz`_ blueprint for details; * option to split off the alarms persistence into a separate database. See the `Dedicated database for the alarm part of ceilometer`_ blueprint for details; * metering of Neutron networking services: LBaaS, FWaaS & VPNaaS. You can enable it manually in Ceilometer if you are going to deploy additional Fuel plugins: - LBAAS: https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-neutron-lbaas - FWAAS: https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-neutron-fwaas - VPNAAS: https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-neutron-vpnaas * support for persisting events via the MongoDB storage driver (previously limited to SQLAlchemy). See the `Enable event feature on MongoDB and DB2`_ blueprint for details; * support for per-device metering of instance disks. See `Add support to gather per-device metrics for instances`_ blueprint for details; * Ceilometer now uses oslo.messaging instead of openstack.common.rpc. See the `Switch to oslo.messaging`_ blueprint for details; * option to use notifications instead of RPC for metering messages. See the `Replace RPC cast() with notifications`_ blueprint for details; * external MongoDB support. See the `Implement possibility to set external MongoDB connection`_ blueprint for details; * Ceilometer and VCenter integration. See the `Implement possibility to setup ceilometer compute agent on controller`_ blueprint for details. .. _`tooz`: https://github.com/stackforge/tooz .. _`Rebase partitioned alarm evaluation on tooz`: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/hash-based-alarm-partitioning .. _`Dedicated database for the alarm part of ceilometer`: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/dedicated-alarm-database .. _`Enable event feature on MongoDB and DB2`: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/mongodb-events-feature .. _`Add support to gather per-device metrics for instances`: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/instance-per-disk-measurement .. _`Switch to oslo.messaging`: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/switch-to-oslo.messaging .. _`Replace RPC cast() with notifications`: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/replace-rpc-cast-with-notifications .. _`Implement possibility to set external MongoDB connection`: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/external-mongodb-support .. _`Implement possibility to setup ceilometer compute agent on controller`: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/ceilometer-support-for-vcenter

commit_message:
MOS-RN6.1 Keystone resolved issues

Adds Keystone resolved issue to the MOS 6.1
Release Notes page:

- keystone doesn't respond if cluster is actively used.

Change-Id: I4671d171932585c4adfad69ab3550128f1376c63
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/68/185568/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Resolved Keystone Issues ++++++++++++++++++++++++ * The eventlet monkeypatching now precedes the logging system initialization. Previously, it occurred after the logging system initialization, thus leaving all the locks used in the logging handlers non-patched and breaking ``threading.RLock``. The initialization order is fixed, so eventlet locks work correctly. See `LP1413341`_. .. _`LP1413341`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1413341
deleted_lines: Resolved Keyston Issues +++++++++++++++++++++++ Known Keyston Issues ++++++++++++++++++++

commit_message:
Added method for connect to node and run command

Added method for connect to node on ssh and run command
on this host. This is change need for adding custom
scenario to scenario tests
bp custom-checks

Change-Id: Ieb99ea99df1c8b8b0477261b8c050455426435ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/19/185419/28 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest_lib.common import ssh as connectionfrom sahara.utils import crypto as ssh self.private_key, self.public_key = ssh.generate_key_pair() self.key_name = 'scenario_key' self.nova.nova_client.keypairs.create(self.key_name, public_key=self.public_key) self.addCleanup(self.nova.nova_client.keypairs.delete, self.key_name) kwargs['user_keypair_id'] = self.key_name def __run_command_on_node(self, node_ip, username, command): ssh_session = connection.Client(node_ip, username, pkey=self.private_key) ssh_session._get_ssh_connection() ssh_session.exec_command(command)

commit_message:
Replace xrange() with six.moves.range()

Add "from six.moves import range" to replace the builtin range()
function with six.moves.range() to always create an iterator, instead of
creating a temporary list.

Replace "xrange" with "range".

Don't add the import for ranges of 1024 items or less.

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: If618b4e810e444f7eb6592bb2398805e9d14d548

removed safely.

commit_message:
Add networking-sfc to the list of affiliated Neutron projects

The project is being bootstrapped in [1,2], this change reflects
that in the sub_projects doc.

metricd: start several processes to process more metric

This starts one process per CPU to maximize throughput in metric
treatment.
